wasteActions.title: Straws
wasteActions.text: Refuse plastic straws | Use a metal / glass straw
wasteActions.text_1stPerson: I used a metal or glass straw today
wasteActions.fact: 500 million straws are thrown away every day in the US.

wasteActions.title: Recycling
wasteActions.text_1stPerson: I recycled everything I could today
wasteActions.fact: The average person generates over 4 pounds of trash every day and about 1.5 tons of solid waste per year

wasteActions.title: Plastic Bottles
wasteActions.text: Refuse plastic water bottles | Use a glass or stainless steele bottle
wasteActions.text_1stPerson: I used a reusable bottle today
wasteActions.fact: A 1 - liter plastic bottle takes 7 liters of water to produce and the average time for a plastic bottle to completely degrade is at least 450 years

wasteActions.title: Coffee
wasteActions.text: Bring your own coffee cup or glass
wasteActions.text_1stPerson: I brought my own coffee cup
wasteActions.fact: Even if the coffee cup says it is recyclable, only about 1 % ever actually get recycled.In the meantime, in the US alone we throw away 25 billion Styrofoam coffee cups a year.

wasteActions.title: Containers
wasteActions.text: Take containers for left overs when eating out
wasteActions.text_3rdPerson: Take your own take away container
wasteActions.text_1stPerson: I brought my own take away container
wasteActions.fact: Take out containers contribute over 13 % of the material reaching landfills in the U.S.

wasteActions.title: Plastic Bags
wasteActions.text: Refuse plastic bags | Use a canvas bag
wasteActions.text_1stPerson: I used a canvas bag today
wasteActions.fact: Worldwide about 2 million plastic bags are used every minute.Many countries have successfully banned plastic bags, and put a hefty fine on anyone found using one, and even jail time in some countries!

wasteActions.title: Adventures
wasteActions.text_3rdPerson: Pickup 1 bag of trash when ever you go on an adventure and share tag# adventurebag
wasteActions.fact: Not only is litter unsightly and capable of ruining our experience in nature, it also poses danger to animals that may ingest it.

wasteActions.title: Compost
wasteActions.fact: Composting is an effective way to reduce greenhouse gas emissions....By composting, the generation of greenhouse gases, particularly methane, is avoided

wasteActions.title: Reuse
wasteActions.text: Use reusable plates / napkins and silverware
wasteActions.text_3rdPerson: Use reusable plates / napkins and silverware
wasteActions.text_1stPerson: I used reusable plates / napkins and silverware
wasteActions.fact: Reusable dishware will use far less energy and resources over its lifetime than its disposable counterparts.Even with the energy and water needed to wash items, the overall environmental impact is substantially less than single - use, thow-away items

wasteActions.title: Lunch
wasteActions.text: Pack your lunch in resuable containers
wasteActions.text_3rdPerson: Packed my lunch in reusale containers
wasteActions.text_1stPerson: I packed my lunch in reusable containers
wasteActions.fact: The choices you make about how your food is produced, packaged, and transported affect the state of the climate, the air we breathe, and the water we drink.Ultimately it affects the health of our children.

wasteActions.title: Toothpaste
wasteActions.text_1stPerson: I made my own tooth paste

wasteActions.title: Shampoo
wasteActions.text_1stPerson: I made my own shampoo Waste

wasteActions.title: Bulk
wasteActions.fact: According to BIG, there is an average reduction of emission by 48 percent each time a product is refilled from bulk versus the same product bought in traditional packaging.
